name: plug.dj - Transparent buttons and menus
description: A follow-up style to Transparent UI, this style makes all the other stuff Transparent UI doesn't touch, to make all buttons and remaining menus equally as transparent.
obsoletion_message: plug.dj is now a Rowl-owned asset, and has returned to business.
additional_info: Information Also see these other styles; Transparent UI Transparent playlist and user menus Transparent dashboard and store Transparent dialog boxes Transparent miscellany Using Color-coded user actions? instructions for using that with this style at the top of the code, so it looks as it does now, save for modified action buttons. Instructions for using Fancy DJ and vote buttons have also been included! The update is here! This style does a bunch of stuff that the Transparent UI style doesn't do. What it affects: - Vote buttons - DJ button - Room into and buttons Moved into Transparent playlist and user menus; See update log - Plug menu - Settings menu > Will be its own style later. - Plugcubed settings menu for Plugcubed users - User panel (top and middle sections only) in its entirety As it stands right now, there doesn't seem to be any bugs with it. Most classes are self-explanatory for those that want to tweak and mod it, but other things are commented just in case. Shouldn't be too hard to use your own colors and make it suit your style. Every bit of text also has text shadow settings for readability. This style should complete the glass-like theme I introduced with Transparent UI. Updates 07/19/14.1 Somehow figured out how to make the vote buttons look more like the regular buttons, when on the booth the buttons are more transparent (representing you cannot interact with them) but when you do interact with them they appear more opaque. 07/19/14.2 Removed icon limitation for vote buttons, so both enabled and disabled woot, grab and meh icons are repositioned correctly. 07/19/14.3 Removed hover for DJ button. Made no sense. 07/22/14 A rather hefty update with a full recreation of the style because I overwrote this with a different version of the style. Should look better than ever, and function like it did before. 07/23/14 Appended onto the user panel action buttons BG hack because some rows were still fully transparent. 12/03/14 Updated style with a more simpler theme, moved some menu items from Transparent UI into this style. 12/04/14 Updated style with improved visual readability of vote buttons. 12/06/14 A BIG update with extra code for users of Color-coded user actions. Follow the instructions at the top of the style code. 12/07/14 Added information about using Fancy DJ and vote buttons with this style 12/11/14 Coding error in vote buttons; Meh made it so active selection did not become more opaque. This update resolves that. 12/13/14.1 Added the create playlist entry in the grab / add popup, themed to match the rest of my transparent themes. 12/13/14.2 Major update to fix missing code block. Also trimmed some comments that weren't necessary. 12/15/14.1 Added specifications for the logout button. 12/15/14.2 Added settings for plugcubed custom chat colours. 01/28/15 The community menu has expanded! With this change, it now acts more like the user menu, and because the implementation was already there sort of, I decided to simply move it into Transparent playlist and user menus. Sorry for whatever weirdness this may cause. 01/28/15 The new gift button is covered in this latest update. Spread the WUBWUBWUB. 02/13/15.1 So plug.dj recently added a video-only feature that completely breaks a bunch of plugins and some styles. After working on my Fancy vote and DJ buttons style, I finally had the base to work from, but it took a bit of effort to work that style into here. Nonetheless it is done, nothing looks broken thus far. 02/13/15.2 Added DJ button left background for left. The code was there, just there was nothing specified. 02/14/15 Made the avatar background in the video-only button transparent 02/06/15 Tooltip arrows are now in the style, and comments in the code have been updated to accurately reflect locations in the code to modify.
